{All about: "data"...}
Blog about my journey in Data Science

Kaggle: Right Whale identification

29 Dec 2015 nanodegree machine-learning

I participated in a team of Udacity Data Analyst Nanodegree alumnies (DANDy Lions) to entry in Kaggle competition of identifying right whales.

Parse and import documentation from XML and DOCX files into LMS

15 Aug 2015 nanodegree data-wrangling

XML to CSV custom parser. Convert document paragraphs and chapters of technical and law documentation into csv table.

Data Visualization of FIFA Development Projects

10 Mar 2015 nanodegree visualization d3JS

This project is implementing of task from Data Visualization course in Udacity Data Analyst Nanodegree. For this project, I’ve created a data visualization from a data set of FIFA developments projects that showcase how this worldwide organisation invest money in football development.

Identifying Fraud from Enron Email

28 Feb 2015 nanodegree machine-learning

In this project I’ve put my machine learning skills to use by building an algorithm to identify Enron Employees who may have committed fraud based on the public Enron financial and email dataset.

Exploratory Data Analysis of red wines

05 Jan 2015 nanodegree

In this project, I’ve used R and applied exploratory data analysis techniques to explore relationships in one variable to multiple variables and to explore a selected data set for distributions, outliers, and anomalies.

Hi, I am Alex. I am software engineer and data science enthusiast. Working with different reports, SQL queries and data wrangling operations, I have discovered Data Science as a new direction for personal growth. As a first step in my Data Science journey I choose studying at Udacity's Data Analyst Nanodegree. In April 2015, I succesfully graduated from it and finished several projects connected with data. In this blog I will publish all my interesting findings and accomplishments.

I continue to develop in this field and looking for opportunities to explore business and social problems and applicable solutions. My goal is to identify how to improve efficiency and quality based on analytical findings and use Big Data to make effective decisions. It is really exciting to see data's impact on our lives, businesses, environment and society.
